Tiger goes to hunt bugs and get away from the noise. He gets stuck in the root of a tree but luckily he has taken a biscuit tin with him to put the bugs in and finds himself drumming too as he beats on it for the others to come and rescue him.

programme.title: Kipper
programme.desc: Kipper finds an old key and remembers that it is for a clockwork mouse in his toybox. His friend Mouse is unimpressed - its not like a real mouse. Kipper decides the two mice should have a race but, when the clockwork mouse wins, Mouse has had enough and decides to hide the key.

programme.title: Caillou (new 3D)
programme.desc: Caillou wants to be like a real rockstar, but his loud tunes keep disturbing his family. He goes into a rockstar fantasy, where he learns that he doesn’t need to play loudly to make an impact, and finds a new way to rock out – by turning his rock song into a lullaby for Rosie.

programme.title: Caillou (new 3D)
programme.desc: At the park to watch a meteor shower, Caillou is surprised to see a new girl, Tina. Suddenly feeling shy, Caillou pretends to be the fearless Dax Turbo Space Captain who makes first contact with the alien, Shyanne (Tina). This helps Caillou overcome his shyness and make a new space-loving friend.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: When a pretend emergency quickly becomes a real one, its up to Emily to think on her wheels and solve a big problem.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Leo and Hero meet a koala in their garden. The Junior Rangers head Down Under to find a home for the koala, but a pack of wild dogs gets in their way.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: A game of hide and seek results in the discovery of a baby Sumatran rhino! Leo, Katie and Hero go to Sumatra, Indonesia to return the rhino to its mother.

programme.title: Postman Pat Special Delivery Service
programme.desc: Pat and Jess have a special delivery for Mrs Goggins - a Loch Ness Monster locator!

programme.title: Postman Pat Special Delivery Service
programme.desc: Micawbers claws need clipping and Pat needs to deliver the claw clippers and Amy the vet.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing wants to get dizzy on the roundybout so Pando pushes him. Its not long before Bing realises that some dizzy is fun but too much dizzy is not fun at all.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing builds a house out of sofa cushions and Coco decides its perfect for a game of Big Bad Wolf. Bing enjoys being wolfie until hes not allowed into the house he built.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: It’s a hot day and Bing and Flop buy an ice lolly from Gilly the ice cream lady. Before they can eat them a frog hops into Bing’s paddling pool and they go to the rescue. By the time they return to the ice lollies all that’s left are the sticks and a plate of lolly goo.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing gets very enthusiastic when he and Sula paint a mural and his painting starts to drop all over Sulas. Sula is upset until she realises that the painting isnt spoiled, its just different.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing gets stuck when he takes a game of hide-and-seek too far.

programme.title: Oswald
programme.desc: Oswald is excited to meet Henrys cousin, Louie, but as the penguins catch up on old times, Oswald feels left out. Convinced they don’t want him around, Oswald goes home. The penguins suddenly notice Oswald is missing and seek him out. Henry tells Louie what a great friend Oswald is. Happy again, Oswald plays the piano as Henry and Louie dance the Penguin Polka together.

programme.title: Oswald
programme.desc: Oswald decides to grow tomatoes in his back garden, so he and Weenie go to Bingos Bazaar to buy a tomato plant. Once planted, it quickly produces a juicy red tomato, but the next morning the fruit is half-eaten by a snail. Oswald and Weenie plant other tomato plants and the vines produce lots of tomatoes, but overnight they are eaten by snails. Frustrated, Oswald moves the plants into the house, but he soon worries that the snails may be hungry. He leaves half the plants in the garden for the snails and grows the rest on the windowsill for him and Weenie!

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Roland’s Gifts is an internet gift shop; Bob, Leo, Scoop, Muck and Lofty are in its huge distrubution warehouse with owner, Roland Sweet. It’s a few days before Christmas and Roland has commissioned Bob and his team to install a hi-tech a robotic picking system, which will pick items off shelving, wrap them and put them into delivery vans via a chute. The system needs to be installed by evening the next day so customers receive their gifts in time for Christmas Day. Scoop and Muck are excited and do ‘robotic’ impressions; Leo claims to be very knowledgeable about robotics. During the installation Leo switches the system on to prove his knowledge to Scoop. Meanwhile an approaching snowstorm has moved the delivery deadline to that very evening.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Team Bob are preparing to dig the foundations for a skyscraper in Spring City’s new business zone and are under pressure from Mayor Madison to get started. She keeps interrupting their work on Bob’s smart-phone. Scoop and Muck set a challenge to see which of them can dig/clear the earth quickest. Interrupted again, Bob calls a halt but the machines get carried away and keep digging. Scoop goes too deep and hits into something hard underground. Bob calls Anish Bose, the archaeologist, who announces the discovery of Roman ruins. The build will have to halt while they excavate the site. Scoop is filled with remorse and horrified to learn that Romans didn’t have machines like him. An interested crowd starts to gather as Anish discovers more artefacts. Mr Bentley arrives for a progress report but rather than being angry at the lack of progress he is excited by the historic discovery.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse see a beautiful rainbow. When it disappears before Big Nutbrown Hare can see it, they recreate it for him with flowers.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Field Mouse and Little Nutbrown Hare’s favourite tree falls over in a summer storm. Theyre sad until they discover the fallen tree provides an exciting new place to explore.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse are inspired to make a spider’s web, but run into all sorts of comic trouble when they do.

programme.title: Learning Time With Timmy
programme.desc: Timmy loves driving his new go-kart but he has to drive safely. Help him learn when to stop and when to go.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: When Mr Frumble’s morning newspaper disappears off his front step, Huckle sets out to investigate what happened to it. After a number of other innocuous items ‘disappear’ from across town, Huckle ultimately discovers that the culprits are none other than Pig Will and Pig Won’t. They are enthusiastically taking part in Busytown’s Annual Recycling Drive by picking up anything they see that can be recycled./Huckle, Lowly and Sally happen upon a huge tooth and can’t imagine anyone in all of Busytown big enough to own it.

programme.title: Messy Goes To Okido
programme.desc: Messy finds a grey sticky thing that looks like a net in the corner of his bathroom. But what is it - he goes to Okido to find out! He lands in Zoe and Felix’s garden to find them doing some paper gluing to make a picture. Zoe’s communicator rings and Zam tells her that there’s an emergency at Loopy Bridge and she needs their help! When they arrive they see that there’s a crack in Loopy Bridge! Zam says she could fix it but she’s run out of glue… Felix offers his paper glue to her, but she tells him that it won’t be sticky enough, and she needs a special glue.

programme.title: Messy Goes To Okido
programme.desc: Messy is spinning himself around and around in circles across the sitting room… just for fun of course! He loses balance and topples over. Messy sits up and wonders why his windmill came to a dizzy end? He magically transports himself to Okido to find out! In Okido, Zoe and Felix are practising ballet so Messy bounces in to show off his best monster moves until they’re interrupted by the sound of Zoe’s communicator – its Zim calling! They’re invited to help Zim, Zam and Zoom at Magneto Zone.

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcakes Berry Bitty Adventures
programme.desc: Sour teasing Apple escalates into a "prank war" between the two of them. After the girls feud disrupts the town, they are sentenced in a Berry Bitty City-style trial to camp alone together for a whole weekend. Miraculously, they emerge best buds, and their friends are relieved, until Sours influence on Apple turns her into a mini-Sour, and they have to do a personality "makeover" on Apple.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Harry has a cold but gets bored of staying in bed so decides to go and play in Dino world.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: A preschool boy named Harry receives a bucket full of toy dinosaurs. This bucket holds a secret --- by using its power, Harry can travel with his dinosaurs to an amazing land of imagination called Dino World.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Katie finds out that a big fish in the garden pond is a whitespotted bamboo shark. The Junior Rangers sail to the Pacific Ocean to find a coral reef for the bamboo shark to live in.

programme.title: Thomas and Friends
programme.desc: Percy is late to collect some sheep for an agricultural fair and bumps the wagon in his rush to be coupled up, backing into other trucks behind him. Percy is in such a hurry to collect the sheep that he doesn’t realise that there is a hole now at the back of the wagon. One by one the sheep escape without Percy realising. Thomas passes Percy and discovers the sheep and is forced to top and collect them. But the only place for the sheep to ride is in Annie or Clarabel!

programme.title: Thomas and Friends
programme.desc: When snow strands Spencer on Sodor, he delights in boasting to the other engines by talking about meeting the abominable snowman, which frightens Henry. The next day Spencer is reluctantly put to work helping Henry and he delights in teasing Henry about the abominable snowman again, taking every opportunity to play up his fear, but when they meet a man covered from head to toe in snow, it is Spencer who is the most frightened of all and it is Henry out tries to protect him. Luckily the snow covered man turns out to be the Fat Controller.

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: The film director Ratatino is filming a report on firefighters when he sprains his wrist. Grisu then accepts the mission of being a cameraman in Ratatinos stead. The young dragon is very excited first as he gets to shoot his favorite subject: firefighters at work. But his task soon gets difficult as Ratatinos wanting "action, action and more action" causes bumping and falling and flame throwing and other comic mishaps. At some point Ratatino gets Grisu so upset that he breathes fire and destroy the cameras memory card. Fortunately theres another one left and Grisu goes film a real rescue at the farm and manages to shoot awesome images

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: When Mr Guellec loses all his wild pineapple seeds in a fire, Grisu decides to go to the jungle with Dr Natureza to get new ones, and thus save Mr Guellecs crop. Once there, Natureza gets attacked by mosquitos and Grisu has to complete the mission all by himself.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: One Autumn day Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse convince Little Grey Squirrel to leave his pile of spotted acorns unattended, so they can all play with the crunchy leaves. While they’re gone Little Redwood Fox discovers the yummy acorns and takes them home. Once she finds out they actually belong Little Grey Squirrel, she has to decide whether to give them back or keep them.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: The first snowfall of the Winter blankets the entire meadow, and Little Nutbrown Hare is confused because he can no longer see the bush, the log or his seedpod ball under all the snow! Will Little Nutbrown Hare be able to find his way around the meadow now that all his familiar places are covered under a blanket of fresh white snow?

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Edmond lives happily with his three little badger cubs in their underground sett. One day, he falls in love with Marguerite, a fox! Marguerite and her daughter move into the family home, turning life upside-down for everyone, who now needs to find a new way to live together in harmony.Directed by: Florian Ferrier (France, 2018)

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: When Bob and the team are asked to build a set for movie-star Dash Lightning’s new film, Muck thinks that his dreams have come true. Dash Lightning is Mucks’ hero, so he decides that he wants to meet him whilst working at Spring City Studios. But when Muck gets distracted with trying to find his hero, he doesn’t pay attention to any of the jobs he is doing. On racing to meet his hero, Muck clips the set’s backdrop and he doesn’t wait to check the pyrotechnic lights, causing them to fall towards the studio-lighting crane. Just as the director calls action, the set falls apart and the pyrotechnics explode towards the lights, risking a fire.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Jenny Dobbs commissions Bob and team to build Komodo Island with a walkway/bridge for the public to gain a better view of the Komodo Dragons. Muck discovers he is terrified of the Komodos so is set to work clearing out their old enclosure (without his knowledge) instead. When he discovers some eggs buried in the earth there he braves returning to the Island to ask Jenny what to do with them. But a Komodo hisses at him and Muck is spooked - he backs into part of the walkway causing it to collapse and leaving Leo dangling in mid air from a safety harness. When Muck sees the Komodo apparently climbing the tree to attack Leo he overcomes his fears to go back and save him.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: When a new nameplate is about to be placed on the statue of Admiral Hornblast, it suddenly disappears. Huckle, Sally and Lowly check out the photos and videos taken at the scene and ultimately determine that the statue slide over the plate when it was bumped by an out of control bulldozer./Pig Will and Pig Won’t are playing spies. However Pig Won’t suddenly finds himself out of the game when his Secret Spy Ring disappears!

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Leo discovers that a satin bowerbird has been stealing blue objects from him and his family. Realising that the satin bowerbird might be lost, the Junior Rangers set out to bring the satin bowerbird back to its bower.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Today’s mission: return a white-bellied woodpecker to its rightful place in the rainforest! The Junior Rangers try to do just that, but come under attack by a swarm of wasps. Will the Junior Rangers succeed in their mission, or face the sting of defeat?

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: Simon and his little brother Gaspard are spending the weekend at Grandpa and Grandma’s house in the country. In the vegetable garden, Simon is surprised that the tomatoes are all green. Grandpa tells him that little elves paint them red during the night. Simon and his brother decide to sleep outside that night, next to the tomatoes, in order to make sure that the elves really do exit! Unfortunately, they fall asleep. And when they wake up the next morning, all the tomatoes are red! And there is a tiny little paintbrush right next to them. It turns out that Grandpa and Grandma also slept outside, not far from the tomatoes!

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry the snailboy and Dolly the ladybird are the best friends ever. They’re having many pretty adventures in 3X13 short tales, while they make new friends and get knowledges about the world around them.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly 01 Mepe 1007 - Christmas
programme.desc: The characters in the Berry and Dolly stories are a bunch of tiny bugs and beetles who live alongside one another in the forest. The stories are lead by the title characters: Berry the snail and Dolly the ladybird. A variety of other characters join them in their fun and games throughout the series with the stories set in their forest home. All the characters’ houses, belongings and clothes perfectly match their individual appearance.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: It turns out whether there are witches or not, and that it is not nice to frighten others.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry and Dolly goes to the kindergarten and the day passes fast with lot of interesting plays.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Balthazar really gets to like the unknown bumblebee girl, and with the help of the friends he even builds a house for her.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry and Dolly accidentally ruin the snowman of Balthazar but finally they build an even nicer one jointly.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry and Dolly insist on seeing an octopus. They manage to get to the home island of the octopus and in the way back home rainbow-fishes help them.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Flop find a patch of fluffy dandelions and blow all but one. Bing takes the last one to give to Sula but when she hugs him to say hello, the dandelion blows away.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing is vooshing with Hoppity around the garden, making him fly higher and higher. With one particularly enthusiastic throw Hoppity disappears. After a hunt, Bing finds Hoppity in the washing up bowl and gets upset because a wet, mucky Hoppity just doesn’t feel right.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and his friends play Nature Explorers in Ammas garden by spinning a giant colour wheel and then finding something of that colour in the garden.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing has enough money to buy one thing in Padgets shop but he finds it hard to choose between all the lovely things. After much deliberation Bing chooses a campervan but on the way home he begins to regret his decision.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: One morning, Molly knocks excitedly on Tildas door: theres going to be a knitting competition in the village. Tilda and Molly at once set off to the village shop to buy some wool. All the other inhabitants of Wild Rose Lane are also buying knitting materials. The competition makes rivals of the friends and they work alone, quietly and secretly.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: It is almost winter in Wild Rose Lane and the inhabitants are getting their provisions in. Hedgehog Rupert is looking forward to hibernating. But Tilda is sad at the thought of all the nice things her best friend will miss while hes asleep. With the promise that she will cook for him, she persuades Rupert to stay awake and spend the winter at her place.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: When Tilda breaks a teacup right after getting up, for Molly theres only one explanation: its Friday the 13th. At first, Tilda dismisses this as pure superstition. After several further mishaps, however, she begins to worry that maybe there is something to it. Her friends are absolutely convinced.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: One Spring morning a cute spotty ladybird lands on Little Nutbrown Hare and seems to want to stay with him. All his friends admire the interesting little creature and he feels very special indeed. When she eventually flies away Little Nutbrown Hare follows her, wanting her back. But he understands why she left when he discovers she has lots of tiny spotty babies.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: It is a sunny Spring day in the meadow and Little Nutbrown Hare is enjoying all it has to offer. As the day wears on a heavy grey cloud forces Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse to seek shelter from the rain. Will the friends let a little water ruin their fun or will they discover that rainy days can be just as exciting.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare is disappointed when a trail of ants disappears with the delicious Spring berries he’s found. He’s convinced that ants are not very nice, and only after Big Nutbrown Hare explains how the ants were probably taking the berries home to their families does Little Nutbrown Hare forgive them. And when he sees how clever the ants are, he soon wants to be like them.

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: To earn their badges, Wilson and Brewster must rescue Emery, who will pretend to be broken down in a tunnel. They spend so much time bickering that a fed up Emery drives off. It looks like Wilson and Brewster won’t earn their badges – until there’s a power cut causing a real emergency. They work together and rescue a now genuinely stranded Emery!

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Zari and Farah are camping together at an open area in the rainforest, sitting beside a campfire. Farah is using a flashlight and is telling a spooky story. As Farah is narrating to Zari, they hear sounds coming from the tall grass at the edge of the campsite. Farah investigates it with her flashlight but Zari stops her because shes scared. Farah insists that its just a story and they need to help if its an animal in trouble. Zari reluctantly agrees and tell Farah to go first. It turns out to be a small Malayan Tiger Club. Back in the garden, Leo attaches a night-vision motion-activated camera to a tree while Katie stands nearby with her tablet. Leo asks Katie why theyre doing this and Katie replied its to see all the animals that come out at night. Hero tested it out and bark at the camera, causing it to take a picture and send the picture to Katies tablet. Leos watch suddenly rings, revealing Zari and Farah calling them to help with the Malayan Tiger cub they found. Katie examines the picture Zari sent to her and learns more on the animal on her computer. Zari realize that the cub is separated from her mother and ask the Rangers for help, which the Rangers agree with. They ride PlatypusOne and meet up with Zari and Farah. The Junior Rangers arrive and Hero meets with the Malayan Tiger cub and the two gets along. Katie reminds Leo they need to be careful with wild animals and the duo activate their jetpack to scout ahead. The Junior Ranger begins their search with Leo and Katie on the sky while Farah, Zari and Hero search the ground.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Kai is taking pictures of a collection of seashells with his Kaimera at the beach. Suddenly, a Horn-Eyed Ghost Crab appears and moves closer to Kais feet, startling him. Kai calms down and notice the harmless creature loses one of its claws. Kai felt sympathy before the animal runs away from him. He didnt manage to catch up to it, and then Kai notices several holes on the beach near the shore. Back in the garden, Hero had digging holes across the garden. Leo sees this and chase Hero away and tells him to stop digging. Hero then digs back a hole that Katie had just filled in, causing a tired Katie to puts down her shovel and sits down. Leo throws a ball towards the hole to distract Hero, causing Hero to catch it and burying into the hole. As the duo catch their breath, Leos watch starts to beeps, revealing a call from Kai. Kai tells them about the holes and the crab at the beach, then shares the picture to the Junior Rangers. They get into the treehouse and Katie examines it with her computer, explaining that its a Horn-Eyed Ghost Crab. Suddenly a group of seagulls appear to threaten the crab, so the Rangers grab their backpack and rush towards Kais position by riding PlatypusOne. Once they arrived, they see Kai is running around the beach and waves his arms to dismiss the flock of seagulls that been circling the sky above the crab thats been hiding behind a rock. Katie tells Kai its not working, to which Hero even tries to help by barking and flaunting at the seagulls.

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: T’choupi and Nina are busy playing as the chickens roam free in the orchard, pecking for food. But when it comes to bringing the birds back home, they notice Picorette is missing! They manage to track her down, nestling nice and cozy inside Loupiote the dog’s kennel, of all places! She’s come here to lay her eggs and she intends to stay! T’choupi and Nina try to coax her out with various treats… in vain. The problem is, Loupiote is out of a home right now!... But what if they were to find her another kennel??

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: T’choupi gets a surprise when he finds out there’s a second donkey in the hamlet - a female donkey by the name of Cuddles. He and she hit it off immediately, so when Benedicte suggests they take the two donkeys for a walk in the forest, T’choupi and Nina are overjoyed! Only problem is, T’choupi pampers Cuddles so much that she keeps refusing to budge throughout the whole walk: she’d rather stop and chew on the “treats” along the way!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: T’choupi is feeling a bit grumpy. He’s even refusing to play with Nina: our little hero is missing his grandparents and friends back home. But Mom reassures him: it’s normal to sometimes feel a little down when you’re away your loved - ones. To cheer him up, Dad suggests they make changes to the cottage, to remind him of his house back home, and his family! Tchoupi suddenly switches from feeling sad to feeling ecstatic! He’s eager to invite Nina to celebrate this happy day with him… but can’t find her anywhere! This gets him worrying: what if his friend took off because of how unkind he was to her this morning?

programme.title: Charley Goes To School
programme.desc: Ben is pushing his friends around a lot in school today… that’s strange… Until they realize that they all have April Fools signs taped to their backs! Ben laughs and explains that today is April 1st. The whole class spends the day making silly signs and playing jokes on each other! And the grown-ups will not be speared either!...

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Arriving from a faraway island, Julia the little mouse moves into a new home with her mother. There she meets Sam, another young mouse whos long lived with his parents and a whole gang of brothers and sisters. They quickly become inseparable and enjoy a host of fun adventures together.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Sam and Julia find the boisterous Tonio frozen like a statue, in the yard, when he was supposed to bring them a snack! And he doesnt talk anymore, even though hes usually a real chatterbox...

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Sam has a very bad night. He only finds sleep when he lies down on the floor in the morning. Julia finds him there and tries to understand how to get Sam back to sleeping well, in his own bed.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: When Duck’s driver boils an egg in his whistle it leaves Duck making a very funny sound. The other engines think it is very funny, but Mike insists that an engine that can’t whistle is not a proper engine. Mike can be grumpy and tends to overheat, but when he loses his temper with a cow later that day he blows his own whistle cap right off and into a field. Now Mike can’t whistle properly and he’s not very happy about it. He can’t see the funny side of the situation as easily as his friends Rex and Bert.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: The three miniature engines are the smallest on the Island of Sodor. People love to come to see them, but sometimes they don’t seem to take them seriously, making comments about them being cute, or like toys, but not really seeing them as being useful. When it is time for the sheep’s wool to be delivered to market, the Small Controller says it is the miniature engines’ chance to prove how useful they really are. Rex takes on the job and it is all going well, until an overturned cart spills bales of wool onto the line and poor Rex ends up being derailed.

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou and his family visit London, take in all the sights, and even meet the Queen!

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou attends a vehicle show with grandpa and learns all about different kinds of cool cars and trucks.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: Peppino delivers pizzas faster than anyone in Busytown, so when the kids wait an unusually long time for their pizza to arrive, they figure something must be wrong at the pizzeria. But Peppino isnt there and neither is his delivery car. By following his delivery route, the kids ultimately find Peppino stuck in an elevator./‘Fairy dust’ and strange sightings has Hilda Hippo convinced there are real live fairies in Busytown Woods!

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: Monkey loves looking clean; he admires his reflection in the lake when all of a sudden mud flies over to his direction. Can it be? It sure can, that is, if you have a Hippo friend next to you…when Hippo comes to shore, Monkey must play with him his favorite game… “Monkey See Monkey Do”!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: The Why Files (Norman and Hannah) investigate a mystery involving spilled milk, a half-eaten sausage roll, and strange ‘dog like’ footprints…

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: When party celebrations go wrong and help is needed, Fireman Sam and his crew are here to save the day in Pontypandy.

programme.title: Franklin And Friends
programme.desc: Franklin and Bear make a promise to wait for each other before playing on the fire truck at the Firefighter Flapjack Breakfast. But when Bear and his dad get caught in a tree, and Franklin initiates a search for his missing best friend, he realizes that keeping some promises are unrealistic. / When Bear and Franklin lose their new Mega Machine it looks like their game of Submarine Rescue Guys is headed for disaster. But Franklin soon finds that pretending is much better than having a toy that does everything.

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: As the family are gathering in food for the winter, Berry becomes ill and is the focus of her parent’s attention. Her brothers and sisters, who would rather laze around instead of sorting redcurrants or nuts, notice this. Now, one after the other, they all fall ill… with much playacting. Edmund and Margaret are not fooled and come up with a response as they have every intention of having a relaxed moment tasting some nice, fresh redcurrant juice…

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: Help! Sketcky does not have a costume idea for the island party tomorrow. Fortunately, Bubble has a great idea that will make everyone laugh.

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: Sketcky wanted to make sandcastles at the beach, but it started to rain! Doodleboo will give him a good idea to keep himself busy without having to cope with the rain.

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: "It’s so hot!" cries Sketcky! What is better than a Riddleboo to know how to get refreshed?

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Hatty takes Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave bird watching in his garden. They learn how to give the birds everything they need to make sure they are safe, happy and well fed.

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave help Hatty fix his Bubble-Copter. They work out how different things fit together, like nuts and bolts, and choose the right tools for each job.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: The cool Autumn breeze isn’t enough to deter Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse from going out to find what special experiences the day might bring. However, with the weather and wind constantly changing, it’s very hard for the friends continue playing any one game. Will the strange weather spoil their fun, or will it bring them a special experience after all?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Among the newly fallen Autumn leaves Little Nutbrown Hare finds a very peculiar little, hairy, green… ‘something’. Intrigued by what it might be Little Nutbrown Hare asks all his friends, but they all have different answers! It is certainly a very useful ‘something’, great for back scratching and games but it takes Little Grey Squirrel to solve the mystery.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: One bright moonlit Autumn night, the Nutbrown Hares are both having trouble sleeping. As they lay quietly in a pile of leaves they listen to the sounds of the night… swish, hoot, wobble, nibble, croak and splash! They go on a journey to discover what’s making the interesting night noises, but will they work out what sound the moon makes?

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing is sad when his new orange balloon pops so Flop helps him make a Bye Bye Box, a memory box for broken toys too special to throw away.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Pando play on the swings together but when Pando takes longer than his turn, Bing gets angry and runs infront of the swings and gets bumped.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing is building a tower of blocks when Coco takes some to make a rainbow. When Charlie wants to play with the blocks too, they decide to make a new game they can all play.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: If youre very quiet and statue still, then the duckies will come. Today, Bing and Sula are at the park to feed the ducks. Sula is very good at standing still like a statue and only giving a small handful of food to the ducks when they come up to her. Bing, on the other hand, throws all the food into the water at once – not thinking that a big quacking goose will come along and eat it all in one bite!

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Its snack time for Bing so Flop suggests they make a smoothie. When Bings carrot accidentally gets put in the blender, hes upset to disover he cant have it back.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry the snailboy and Dolly the ladybird are the best friends ever. They’re having many pretty adventures in 3X13 short tales, while they make new friends and get knowledges about the world around them.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry the snailboy and Dolly the ladybird are the best friends ever. They’re having many pretty adventures in 3X13 short tales, while they make new friends and get knowledges about the world around them.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: On a hot summer day, Berry, Dolly, Bubble and Balthazar put on their swimsuits, looked for their buckets, shovels and started to build the loveliest sand castle on the Sand Island.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: On a sunny autumn day, Berry and Dolly went into to forest to pick blueberries. Flutter, the butterfly girl, and Eddy, the potato beetle joined them as well. When Eddy saw the fruitful bushes can’t help but pick all the best fruits before the others. What’s left to do?

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: Huckle and the gang race all over Busytown trying to find the lock that fits and old key they found. They search everywhere from the Busytown Museum to Mr Gronkle’s antiques. They come up empty until they remember that an old roll top desk was being delivered to the antique store near where they found the key and had a lock on it. They try the key and it fits. / Chocolate sauce on Lowlys car leaves Huckle and the gang puzzled.

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: All Monkey wants is to eat a nice fresh carrot, but someone has beat him to it. When Monkey discovers that the rabbit is the carrot eater he immediately invites him to play Monkey’s favorite game… “Monkey See Monkey Do”!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Ellie takes the junior cadets into the woods for a training day, but Sam must get things under control when a canister explodes.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Norman films a glimpse of the Pontypandyness Monster using Joe Sparkes Submaster 2000, sparking Monster Mania in Pontypandy.

programme.title: Kipper
programme.desc: Kipper, Pig and Arnold enjoy themselves riding on the Big Wheel and looking in distorting mirrors at the Fair. They decide to go into the maze and Pig worries about Arnold getting lost. Guess who gets lost? It isn’t Arnold!

programme.title: Kipper
programme.desc: Big Owl gets dirty and Kipper decides to give him a bath. Tiger’s hat falls in the mud and they decide to give it a bath too. Things get totally out of hand and they wash blankets, all the other toys and finally themselves.

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: T’choupi and his family arrive at the hamlet for their first day of vacation. Having been told by his parents that their stay will be packed with surprises, T’choupi has high expectations! But disappointment sets in fast: not only does he find the dog daunting, he also notices there’s no slide, or TV, or pool! This place is going to be sooo boring!!... Until he finds out there’s a girl his age living there. "Huh, where?!" T’choupi can’t wait to meet this mysterious potential playmate!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: Dad sends Tchoupi and Nina out on a mission: to go to the vegetable garden and find the veggies he needs to make a nice mixed salad! The kids are delighted… until they discover that the tomatoes - the main ingredient for Dad’s salad - are green instead of red! Nina comes up with a solution she heard about from her mom: music!

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Sam and Julia have been given a great number of cheese star by Mrs Brioche. But Tony and Ella think they should share it with them. M. Grumpy decide to organize a game to bring peace back.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Arriving from a faraway island, Julia the little mouse moves into a new home with her mother. There she meets Sam, another young mouse whos long lived with his parents and a whole gang of brothers and sisters. They quickly become inseparable and enjoy a host of fun adventures together.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: One day, a mouse called Ferdinand Pearstalk turns up on Tildas doorstep and announces that he will be taking over her house: the vicar has swapped churches and with him the church mouse. To Tildas amazement, he immediately moves in. With a heavy heart, Tilda puts all her stuff on a handcart and trundles off.

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: The Triplets are at the beach, and they can’t wait to go swimming!!! Unfortunately, there is a new lifeguard on the beach, and he is not the kind to let anyone have fun... The Triplets can’t either bathe, or make sandcastles, or pirouettes, or kite. What a bummer! The lifeguard whistles constantly, like a quartermaster sergeant against his soldiers. Then the Triplets are going to k really hard to escape the lifeguard and give him the hardest time, who will win this fight?

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: Be friend with a shark, is that even possible? Poet discovers a swimming ring shaped like a shark in the sand. He imagines being friend with a NICE shark which is tired of everyone thinking he’s bad. Turbulent and Girl take him out of his musing and ask him if he wants to join them to fish shrimps. But Poet won’t fish shrimps, no! He will find a shark and make him his new friend. He’ll bring it back to Paris where he will play with it, feed it, learn it how to brush teeth and bed it. Not sure Mommy will agree.

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Rosie, Scoutbadger, Woodsy and Berry decide to put on a show for their parents. They make a little theatre but Scoutbadger wants to control everything and thinks he is a star. His team quits and each one goes off to rehearse an act alone. Woodsy will juggle with plums, Rosie will walk on stilts and Berry will do acrobatics. Meanwhile, Scoutbadger rehearses his ‘one-badger show’ but finally goes hoarse…

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou learns how to make fresh pasta and pizza at home!

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou is worried theres a monster under his bed, so Daddy checks to make him feel better!

programme.title: Thomas and Friends
programme.desc: When snow strands Spencer on Sodor, he delights in boasting to the other engines by talking about meeting the abominable snowman, which frightens Henry. The next day Spencer is reluctantly put to work helping Henry and he delights in teasing Henry about the abominable snowman again, taking every opportunity to play up his fear, but when they meet a man covered from head to toe in snow, it is Spencer who is the most frightened of all and it is Henry out tries to protect him. Luckily the snow covered man turns out to be the Fat Controller.

programme.title: Chuggington
programme.desc: Brewster is learning to use the mega-­‐chug crane, but his training time is cut short when they are called away to fix some damage in a mine tunnel. As they cross the old rickety bridge it collapses, leaving Zack stranded on the other side. How will they ever reach him? Brewster has an idea. The chuggers help him transport the mega-­‐chug crane up the steep mountain. It’s a tough challenge and they nearly don’t manage it, but Brewster is determined. He uses all his crane skills to lift Zack safely out of the high tunnel. Zack could not be prouder of his trainee.

programme.title: Chuggington
programme.desc: Brewster practices track laying by himself, while the Chuggineers work near Rocky Ridge River. Suddenly a storm rolls in and torrential rain lashes down. The riverbank bursts and water pours down the hill, washing away the temporary track that connects the Chuggineers to the main line. Brewster tries to lay more track to reach them, but the ground is too soggy. Chuggers help to sandbag the riverbank to stop the flow of water. When Brewster rolls over a sandbag, it gives him an idea. With the water flow already stemmed, Brewster lays sandbags on the soggy ground and puts track on top. It doesn’t sink. The rescued Chuggineers are amazed at Brewster’s ingenuity and track laying skills.

programme.title: Charley Goes To School
programme.desc: Ben is pushing his friends around a lot in school today… that’s strange… Until they realize that they all have April Fools signs taped to their backs! Ben laughs and explains that today is April 1st. The whole class spends the day making silly signs and playing jokes on each other! And the grown-ups will not be speared either!...

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave race a Speedy Sheep in Racing Land. They discover that races have rules to make them fair and that being fast may help you win a race, but taking part is just as much fun!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: When T’choupi misses out on going to the market with Fred, Nina decides to cheer him up by suggesting they "sell their wares at the market," like a couple of adults -right there, in the hamlet where they live! The friends find some great produce, which they then promptly sell to their parents. The latter are delighted with their wares; only problem is, Dad would have loved to be able to bake a yummy pie but has no eggs with which to make it…

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Zari and Farah are camping together at an open area in the rainforest, sitting beside a campfire. Farah is using a flashlight and is telling a spooky story. As Farah is narrating to Zari, they hear sounds coming from the tall grass at the edge of the campsite. Farah investigates it with her flashlight but Zari stops her because shes scared. Farah insists that its just a story and they need to help if its an animal in trouble. Zari reluctantly agrees and tell Farah to go first. It turns out to be a small Malayan Tiger Club. Back in the garden, Leo attaches a night-vision motion-activated camera to a tree while Katie stands nearby with her tablet. Leo asks Katie why theyre doing this and Katie replied its to see all the animals that come out at night. Hero tested it out and bark at the camera, causing it to take a picture and send the picture to Katies tablet. Leos watch suddenly rings, revealing Zari and Farah calling them to help with the Malayan Tiger cub they found. Katie examines the picture Zari sent to her and learns more on the animal on her computer. Zari realize that the cub is separated from her mother and ask the Rangers for help, which the Rangers agree with. They ride PlatypusOne and meet up with Zari and Farah. The Junior Rangers arrive and Hero meets with the Malayan Tiger cub and the two gets along. Katie reminds Leo they need to be careful with wild animals and the duo activate their jetpack to scout ahead. The Junior Ranger begins their search with Leo and Katie on the sky while Farah, Zari and Hero search the ground.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly 01 Mepe
programme.desc: The characters in the Berry and Dolly stories are a bunch of tiny bugs and beetles who live alongside one another in the forest. The stories are lead by the title characters: Berry the snail and Dolly the ladybird. A variety of other characters join them in their fun and games throughout the series with the stories set in their forest home. All the characters’ houses, belongings and clothes perfectly match their individual appearance.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry and Dolly goes to the kindergarten and the day passes fast with lot of interesting plays.

programme.title: Bing Bunny

programme.title: Bing Bunny

programme.title: Bing Bunny

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing makes Sula a picture with all her favourite things on it. It just needs one last jewel stuck on but oops the glue spills all over the picture. Sparkles save the day.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Sula, Pando, Flop and Padget all have a knack, something special they can all do and Bing gets frustrated when his own knacks are easy for everyone else to do.

programme.title: Bing Bunny - Shorts and characters

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: Gaspard is doing everything Simon does. He even thinks he’s Super Rabbit! Enough is enough and Simon decides to turn the tables on his brother by repeating everything Gaspard says. But Simon finally understands that if Gaspard is copying him, it’s because he wants to be just like him, he admires his older brother. So Simon goes back to being a sweet, caring older brother and suggests that since there’s only one Super Rabbit, then he can become…Capitan Rabbit! Yippee!!

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: While their parents are absent, Scoutbadger, Rosie and Woodsy have to agree on the next family outing. Rosie and Scoutbadger quickly have different suggestions. Each tries to persuade Woodsy to vote for their idea. Finally, Woodsy comes up with a different suggestion but is disappointed when the other two do not even listen to him. Woodsy is peeved and goes to find Loudo, determined to make his voice heard in some other way.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Can you guess how much I love you? Little Nutbrown Hare asks his father. Big Nutbrown Hare looks up at the big, old oak tree. As much as the Old Oak Tree is big? he asks. Little Nutbrown Hare holds up an acorn in triumph. No, as big as this acorn! He replies. Because this acorn will just keep growing and growing and growing.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: One morning in the early Springtime, Little Nutbrown Hare wakes to find the air filled with a delightful smell. He and Little Field Mouse search all over the meadow, the woods and by the riverside to find the source of the wonderful smell. They discover all kinds of new and unexpected Spring scents… sweet, pretty and fresh, but will they find the one they are searching for?

programme.title: Boribon
programme.desc: Boribon receives a football for his name day. He excitedly starts playing with it, but as he doesnt know the rules, hes a little clumsy. Fortunately, Ben comes by on his scooter and starts teaching Boribon. Practice pays off and Boribon scores his first goal.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Arriving from a faraway island, Julia the little mouse moves into a new home with her mother. There she meets Sam, another young mouse whos long lived with his parents and a whole gang of brothers and sisters. They quickly become inseparable and enjoy a host of fun adventures together.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Tonight there is a children show for the parents. Julia planned a scooter act with Sam. But Sam doesnt dare to tell her he is very bad on those wheels. How long can he avoid to tell her the truth?

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: When the Triplets are going to the beach, Turbulent offers to carry the umbrella but it seems too heavy for him and Mommy asks him if he wants help. But no ! « I am strong » answers Turbulent. Then comes the lifeguard to help them, he is super strong with giant muscles and Turbulent is very impressed. Plus, the lifeguard has won the "Mister Beach" competition. It’s decided, Turbulent will do exactly the same. He decides to start exercising, doing a lot of push ups and weightlifting. But sport is really hard. And Turbulent would rather play with his brother and sister.

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: The Triplets are having fun in the park with Toto when the dog suddenly rushes after Mrs Gzells cat, well actually rather after the cookie the cat had in its mouth. He runs like the wind and for the Triplets, Toto is THE Champion. But Mrs Gzell replies that if he’s so strong like they say, he should take part to the dog championship the next day. The Triplets are sure Toto will win everything, the competition of snoring, of barking and even the eating contest. Unfortunately, when the competition begins, those are not the challenges the Triplets were expecting.

programme.title: Chuggington
programme.desc: The Chuggineers are busy constructing a new station. Brewster gets under everybody’s wheels until Zack lets him take the welding wagon away to practice with. Down an old disused line, Brewster finds lots of old junk to weld together. Koko persuades him to go exploring along an overgrown track. They cross a dried out streambed and the rusty track collapses behind them, leaving them stranded. They both need to get back -­‐ Brewster has to return Zack’s welder wagon and Koko has a passenger run. Suddenly Brewster realizes that he might be able to mend the track by welding it.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: With the cadets stoked to take a helicopter ride on Wallaby 2, Sam and Elvis must pull a high-flying rescue when a scary incident occurs.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: It’s fright night for Norman after he watches a scary movie, but his panic leaves him thinking everyone is turning into Pontypandy Zombies… Pondies. He tries to signal for help but ends up trapped in a burning building. The Fire Team are called to the rescue.

programme.title: Kipper
programme.desc: At the seaside Tiger just wants to read his book. Kipper keeps interrupting him so Tiger tells him to go for a swim. Kipper plays ball with a friendly sea lion but Tiger doesn’t believe him. He finishes his book and Kipper starts reading – now he wants to be left alone. Tiger meets the sea lion too and soon all three of them play happily together, book forgotten

programme.title: Kipper
programme.desc: Kipper, Tiger and Pig decide to have a race. The prize is one of Pig’s chocolate cakes. Tiger goes on his tricycle and ends up in the duck pond but Kipper keeps running. Arnold gets a lift with Jake on his scooter. Guess who gets the chocolate cake?

programme.title: Caillou (new 3D)
programme.desc: When Caillou’s over-enthusiasm accidentally scares away the birds on his backyard bird feeder, he jumps into an explorer fantasy where he is pursued by a very enthusiastic but friendly Bigfoot (Mommy) and learns to soften his approach in order to see the birdies up close.

programme.title: Caillou (new 3D)
programme.desc: When Caillou thinks his snow buddy isnt as good as Sarahs, his feelings of inadequacy inspire an Ace Builder fantasy. Caillou learns that just because something is different, doesnt mean its better or worse, its just different!

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: In India, Thomas encourages Shankar to enter a costume contest, but Shankar doesnt feel comfortable being in the spotlight.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Zari was backpacking through the forest where she discovers a bunch of discarded leaves and branches on the floor due to the aftermath of the storm. As she investigate further, the wind blows a paper cup near her. Zari was perplexed as she mistaken the insect with an actual leaf, causing her to call in the Rangers. Back at the headquarters, Leo is searching for Hero and Katie as theyre playing hide And seek. As Leo is struggling to find Katie, he receives a call from Zari, who asks for help with the strange animal. Leo and Katie travels with PlatypusOne to reach Zari. As they arrived, Zari tells them to be careful because the leaves on the ground could be a Malayan Leaf insect too. After carefully going investigate and not finding any, the wind manage to blow the Malayan Leaf insect out of Katies hand. Leo chases it down with his jetpack, manage to safe the animal from harm. The gang then tries to find a proper place for the insect. They then stumble a new location, where a mouse-deer is nearby. Leo put the insect on a high branch, when suddenly they got greeted by Ranger Rocky. He then calls for Ranger Joey for more information on the Malayan Leaf Insect, where she fully explains its habitat and predators that may appear. She advices them that the mouse-deer might mistake the insect as an actual leaf and would eat it, where Leo take the advice and put the insect somewhere higher on the trees. The Rangers went home where Leo put the Malayan Leaf insect photo on the wall. He then figured to look for Katie and hero to continue their game earlier, but Katie and Hero was already inside the treehouse, indifferent to Leos game. Ranger Rocky finally thanks them for a great job on the computer screen.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: As Farah is drawing poop on her handbook in the national park, she hears a loud growl nearby and leaps onto her dirtbike to seek the source. She sees a lioness and her cub stuck inside a man-made well, clumsily failing to get out. She immediately calls the Rangers for help. Back in the garden, Leo And Katie were playing frisbee. Katie tries to do throw it just like Leo does it but she fails, upsetting her. As Leo instructs Katie on how to do it, he receives the call from Farah. Farah tells them about the trapped animals, causing the duo to learn more about the lion back in the treehouse. Farah then informs them of more lions coming over, where Leo tells her to get to safety first. As the Rangers arrive and land PlatypusOne from afar, Leo uses his binoculars and sees the 2 female lions still roaming around the well. They see Farah hides on top of a nearby hill and meet her there. As they were discussing on how to help the lioness, Katie points out a fallen log nearby that can be used. Farah misunderstood and rush onto her bike to cause a distraction for the 2 lioness around the well, but Ranger Rocky appears and stops her. Ranger Rocky then ask more information on the Asiatic Lion from Ranger Joey. Ranger Joey advices them about the Asiatic Lions hunting behavior, giving the group an idea to pretend as a Sambar Deer to distract the animal there.

programme.title: Postman Pat Special Delivery Service
programme.desc: Pat and Jess are off to Cardiff in the SDS plane to collect a new sorting machine!

programme.title: Postman Pat Special Delivery Service
programme.desc: It’s a snowy day in Greendale, and Ted Glen has invited the kids to his workshop to meet his friend, space expert Professor Farrow. Julian’s excited but so is Pat, who has always yearned to be an astronaut. He’s even more thrilled when he finds that his special delivery is a space suit - an extra surprise for the kids. When his van breaks down in a snowy lane, he finds an ingenious solution - only to suffer a puncture - and Ted is unable to help... Meanwhile, Professor Farrow and Lauren take the kids out into the snow and re-create the surface of the moon. Pat’s determined to make his delivery, but how will he make it on foot through the snow?

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Flop are building a sandcastle when Pando joins them in the sandpit with his wind-up digger toy to help. Bing finds a lovely ‘poiky thing’ in the sand and thinks it will make the perfect decoration for the top of his castle not realizing it belongs to Pando’s digger.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Sula collect acorns in the park with Flop, but Bings pile keeps shrinking.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: The series follows a pre-school bunny named Bing as he experiences the world around him. It uses small everyday occurrences to demonstrate how he learns new ways to manage situations with the help of his carer, Flop and friends. The programmes central phrase is "Its a Bing thing!" which Flop intones at the end of each episode when Bing has successfully conquered a troubling task or enjoyed a new childhood experience.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Flop is feeling poorly so Bing decides to look after him. When Bing tries to make Flop a honey-lemon drink he ends up making a big mess instead.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Sula and Pando and me did music all together.

programme.title: Oswald
programme.desc: Oswald takes Weenie to the Big City Pet Show. There are a number of interesting pets competing - a robot cat called Tinsel, a slug named Sluggo, Steve Trees woodpecker Woody - but Oswald is sure that Weenie will win first prize as the Best Pet. However, Weenie doesn’t do well in the competition, because she is distracted by Woody who’s escaped and is chipping away at the tent pole, endangering everyone. In the nick of time, Weenie saves the day, and proves that she is the best pet of all.

programme.title: Oswald
programme.desc: Oswald and Daisy go bird watching. Oswald tells Daisy she has to be quiet and still. But Daisy is too full of energy – each time they find a bird, she makes a noise and scares it away. Finally Oswalds had enough, and he goes off bird watching on his own. But Oswald encounters a giant bird which accidentally flies off with him. The resourceful Daisy proves her worth when she rescues Oswald.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: It’s Christmas time. Bob and the team are building the Spring City Christmas display in the city centre’s plaza. Lofty loves everything Christmas and decorates the yard in snowflakes. Then he sees that Bob’s home doesn’t have any decorations, so he decides to give him the perfect present. Lofty arrives on site, determined to give Bob his Christmas present but when asked to help hang the lights, he puts the present down by the giant display tree. Lofty finishes his work and again tries to give Bob his present but now it’s lost somewhere in the display.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob must finish a Dinosaur Park attraction for the Mayor to visit that evening. This involves creating a trail around which life-sized models of dinosaurs will be positioned, climaxing with a roaring animatronic model of a triceratops. Muck starts to clear the main path. He’s fascinated, but also a little bit scared of dinosaurs. Leo reassures Muck by revealing he too was a bit wary of dinosaurs when he was small, and gets Muck to roar like a dinosaur. The model dinosaurs arrive and are very impressive. Scoop decides to surprise Leo and pushes the triceratops into the middle of the path. Instead of surprising Leo, they spook Muck who panics and knocks the model over a cliff.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: When Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse find a strange set of prints in the snow and hunt for the owner, their imaginations run away with them

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare discovers he cant fit under his favourite hiding log anymore. With Big Nutbrown Hares help, he learns he has grown bigger since last Spring, and can now clamber into a hole in a tree thats an even better hiding place. Big Nutbrown Hare learns that you are never too young to play.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: When Big Nutbrown Hare tells Little Nutbrown Hare a beautiful full moon will rise that night, Little Nutbrown wants to invite all his friends around for a celebration. When the full moon is veiled in clouds, Little Nutbrown is disappointed - but is extra delighted when the clouds part to reveal a bright red moon.

programme.title: Learning Time With Timmy
programme.desc: Timmy and his friends are making a train out of lots of different shapes. Can you help them?

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: Trying to figure out what a strange piece of metal with a number 10 on it is, Huckle and his pals take it to Blacksmith Bear who helps them discover strange writing on it. Figuring it must be a foreign language, they take it to Ms Honey and, with her help, determine the piece of metal is a lost tap from Hilda’s French tap dance shoes./Huckle and pals set out to find the whistle blower who is causing a traffic jam.

programme.title: Messy Goes To Okido
programme.desc: Messy is running around in his garden and notices his shadow chasing him and copying everything he does! Trying to figure out how to get rid of it, he goes to Okido. When he arrives, his shadow has followed him and then he spots more shadows on the side of Felix and Zoe’s house. He looks up to find his friends on the balcony of their treehouse, making shadow puppets. He bounces up to join them and then all of a sudden the shadows disappear…

programme.title: Messy Goes To Okido
programme.desc: Messy is hiding in a tent made of cushions, pretending not to be scared of the storm outside! He wonders why the sky is flashing and being so noisy! So he spins to Okido to find the answer. When Messy arrives, Zoe and Felix are lounging, warm and dry in deck chairs, but it appears to be raining on him, and he can’t escape it! “Look up Messy!” giggles Zoe. It’s Fluff the cloud! She’s been watering Felix and Zoe’s garden and now needs to go home so invites the trio to come and meet her family.

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcakes Berry Bitty Adventures
programme.desc: Berrykin Blooms braggart cousin, Berrykin Bertram, has won the hot sauce competition at the local county fair year after year. But this year, Sour and Apple are determined to help the kindhearted Bloom win... whether he wants to or not!

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Harry is finding it difficult to learn to play the violin and is fearful about performing in his school concert so he goes to Dino-World to practice.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: When Harry discovers that he is too small to pick apples he goes to the Dino-World Mooseum to find some growth enhancing milk from a mechanical cow.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Leo meets an Atlantic puffin in the garden while playing with his remote-controlled car. The Junior Rangers decide to take the puffin home to Iceland. There, Leo has a mishap at the edge of a cliff.

programme.title: Thomas and Friends
programme.desc: Salty loves to talk about things like sea monsters and to tell tall tales and scary stories that sometimes frighten other engines. Then one day the Fat Controller decides to lend Salty to help out at a port on the mainland. Salty is happy to help, until he hears that the bridge is out and that he must travel by ship. Than Salty’s wild imagination gets the better of him and he runs away. His scary stories have scared him too and now he’s the one who has to overcome his fears!

programme.title: Thomas and Friends
programme.desc: Diesel is not a very helpful engine, but at Christmas, when there is so much extra work to be done, his unhelpfulness is really unwelcome and unkind, especially when he refuses to stop for Paxton who has been derailed. Thomas decides to help Diesel see the error of his ways. Over the course of the next few days Diesel is visited by what appear to be ‘ghostly engines’ who remind him just how unhelpful he has been in the past, the joy helping others can bring at Christmas and the danger that if you don’t help others they might not come to help you when you really need them. When Diesel becomes derailed himself and fears that he could be abandoned the message finally hits home.

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: To help David who has to take off for a firefghter operation, Grisu offers to bring a package to the post office. Even if the package matters a lot for David since its a birthday present for his best friend, the mission shouldnt be too difficult. Except that, after an accident, the package ends up in Guellecs van, then in a field with playful sheeps. Grisu and Stella miss the mail and therefore have to deliver the package by themselves. What they will manage to do, thanks to Grisus invention: a cart pulled by drones!"

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: Fume asks his son to watch over the water plant while hes away. Grisu accepts this mission and Stella comes along. But the young dragon accidently pulls the wrong lever, causing the water to heat too much. To cool it down, Grisu and Stella have to turn a wheel but they end up getting it unhinged. Fortunately Grisu and Stella manage to press a red button, which is a like a second line of defence. But their mishaps made the volcano shake and a boulder flattens a hot water hose. As Grisu tries to dislodge it, Fume shows up in the plant unanounced, which makes Stella shout in surprise and startled Grisu burn two stalagmites holding the boulder.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: On a snowy Winter’s morning Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse are amazed at the intricate patterns they find in the snowflakes, each one different from the others. The friends try to take one to show Big Nutbrown Hare, but they always melt before he sees them. Will they find a way to stop the lovely flakes from melting?

programme.title: The Lost Paradise, a portrait of Arvo Part
programme.desc: He is the most performed contemporary composer in the world. Nevertheless, he also rarely ventures out in public, keeps quiet about his music, feels at home in the forests of Estonia and generates therewith – perhaps involuntarily – the impression of a recluse, which is attributed to him again and again: Arvo Part.The Estonian composer, who will celebrate his 90th birthday on September 11, 2025, verily exudes even solely by his appearance an aura of a mystic or an ascetic. He himself says: “I am no prophet, no cardinal, not a monk, not even a vegetarian.” But he is without a doubt a devout man, who has been a member of the Russian Orthodox Church since 1970, and under pressure from the Soviet apparatus of power was forced to leave his native Estonia in 1980. Via Vienna he arrived in Berlin, which for the next 30 years would become his second home and also the starting point for his international career.“The Lost Paradise” is the first international documentary about Arvo Part. It is quite an astonishment that such a shy artist has given his consent to be accompanied by a camera for an entire year: In his native Estonia, travelling to Germany, Italy, and Japan, where Part received the Praemium Imperiale, the world’s most prestigious award in the field of music, in October 2014.The film is framed by the identically named stage production “Adam’s Passion,” featuring three key works by Arvo Part, which American director Robert Wilson brought to the stage in May 2015 in a former submarine factory, the “Noblessner Foundry” in Tallinn.

programme.title: La Grande Danza - Aterballetto in Milan
programme.desc: Aterballetto is the principal producing and touring dance company in Italy. They are well-known for their ability to shift their style across a wide range of musical genres, from classical to pop and jazz. Jiří Pokorny‘s ‘Words and Space’ is a metaphor of an intrapersonal speech, a book full of floating stories. It is personal, intimate, and very poetic.

He himself says: “I am no prophet, no cardinal, not a monk, not even a vegetarian.” But he is without a doubt a devout man, who has been a member of the Russian Orthodox Church since 1970, and under pressure from the Soviet apparatus of power was forced to leave his native Estonia in 1980. Via Vienna he arrived in Berlin, which for the next 30 years would become his second home and also the starting point for his international career.“The Lost Paradise” is the first international documentary about Arvo Part. It is quite an astonishment that such a shy artist has given his consent to be accompanied by a camera for an entire year: In his native Estonia, travelling to Germany, Italy, and Japan, where Part received the Praemium Imperiale, the world’s most prestigious award in the field of music, in October 2014.The film is framed by the identically named stage production “Adam’s Passion,” featuring three key works by Arvo Part, which American director Robert Wilson brought to the stage in May 2015 in a former submarine factory, the “Noblessner Foundry” in Tallinn.
